definitions.definition: (with "the", a demonstrative, or a possessive) Those who have died.
definitions.example: Have respect for the dead.

definitions.definition: (often with "the") Time when coldness, darkness, or stillness is most intense.
definitions.example: The dead of night. The dead of winter.

definitions.definition: (usually plural) Sterile mining waste, often present as many large rocks stacked inside the workings.
To make dead; to deaden; to deprive of life, force, or vigour.

definitions.example: All of my grandparents are dead.

definitions.definition: (of another person) So hated that they are absolutely ignored.
definitions.example: He is dead to me.

definitions.definition: Doomed; marked for death (literally or as a hyperbole).
definitions.example: "You come back here this instant! Oh, you're dead, mister!"
She stood with dead face and limp arms, unresponsive to my plea.
a dead lift

definitions.definition: Without interest to one of the senses; dull; flat.
definitions.example: a dead glass of soda.
dead fields

definitions.definition: (of a machine, device, or electrical circuit) Completely inactive; currently without power; without a signal.
definitions.example: Now that the motor's dead you can reach in and extract the spark plugs.

definitions.definition: (of a battery) Unable to emit power, being discharged (flat) or faulty.

definitions.example: That monitor is dead; don’t bother hooking it up.
Is this beer glass dead?

definitions.definition: Not imparting motion or power by design.
definitions.example: A dead axle, also called a lazy axle, is not part of the drivetrain, but is instead free-rotating.
Once the ball crosses the foul line, it's dead.

definitions.definition: (of a golf ball) Lying so near the hole that the player is certain to hole it in the next stroke.

definitions.example: dead giveaway
a dead eye
After sitting on my hands for a while, my arms became dead.

definitions.definition: Constructed so as not to transmit sound; soundless.
definitions.example: a dead floor

definitions.definition: Cut off from the rights of a citizen; deprived of the power of enjoying the rights of property.
definitions.example: A person who is banished or who becomes a monk is civilly dead.

definitions.definition: (often with "to") Indifferent to, no longer subject to or ruled by (sin, guilt, pleasure, etc).

definitions.example: He hit the target dead in the centre.

dead wrong; dead set; dead serious; dead drunk; dead broke; dead earnest; dead certain; dead slow; dead sure; dead simple; dead honest; dead accurate; dead easy; dead scared; dead solid; dead black; dead white; dead empty
He stopped dead.
dead tired; dead quiet; dead asleep; dead pale; dead cold; dead still
